column4: fglrx(0): Virtual size is 2560x1024. why in the hell are fglrx  telling my xserver that and HOW do i get rid of it.
looks like you're trying to use an incompatible resolution
RTFM and reconfigure X.Org
I have gone trough my xorg.conf a lot of times and it isn't there, belive me
if you RTFM'ed youd know to reconfigure it with xorgconfig or some other configuration tool
i have done it, already :)
it still messes with me
it isn't in the xorg.
then you selected the wrong resolution
Seriously, no. Ive gone trough my logfile and it is fglrx that keeps telling it this virtual piece of thing. The xorg is so clean it could be
whats your max res
how much video memory
then you might be in luck, hold on a second
i hold on, yes.
ah ok.
Do you know where fglrx places it's own configurationfile?
i had the idea of editing that instead
/etc/X11/xorg.conf usually
ok, the nasty thing is that there seems to be another config.
I did xrandr -s 1 now, and my fluxbox is working yes. The resolution there is set at 2560 as standard, even if that resolution isn't existing in my xorg. D
